title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

a(2) = v'(2) = -0.132 or -0.133
descriptions:

a(2) = v'(2) = -0.132 or -0.133

The student response earns all of the following points:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer with reason

v(2) = -0.436

Speed is increasing since a(2) < 0 and v(2) < 0.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the answer with reason

v(2) = -0.436

Speed is increasing since a(2) < 0 and v(2) < 0.

The student response earns all of the following points:

v(2) = -0.436

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: set v(t) = 0

1 point is earned for identifying t = 0.433 as a candidate

1 point is earned for justifying absolute maximum

v(t) = 0 when tan −1 ( e t )=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaciiDaiaacg gacaGGUbWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaOWaaeWaaeaacaWG LbWaaWbaaSqabeaacaWG0baaaaGccaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0JaaG ymaaaa@400A@

t = ln(tan(1)) = 0.433 is the only critical value for y.

v(t) > 0 for 0 < t < ln(tan(1))

v(t) < 0 for t > ln(tan(1))

y(t) has an absolute maximum at t = 0.433.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: ∫ 0 2 v( t ) dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WG2bWaaeWaaeaacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaleaacaaIWaaabaGa aGOmaaqdcqGHRiI8aOGaamizaiaadshaaaa@3EFE@

1 point is earned for the handles initial condition

1 point is earned for the value of y(2)

1 point is earned for the answer with reason

y( 2 )=−1+ ∫ 0 2 v( t ) dt=−1.360 or −1.361 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5325@

The particle is moving away from the origin since v(2) < 0 and y(2) < 0.
